intro: Tedingea, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing perennial, often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Tedingea prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its ability to produce vibrant blooms throughout the year makes it a popular choice among gardeners.
